title: 3 Git Commands That Will Save Your Life

hook.text: Ever accidentally deleted your entire codebase? These 3 Git commands will save your life.

sections.text: Number one: git reflog. This shows you EVERYTHING you've done, even commits you thought were lost forever. Just run git reflog and find your lost commit.
sections.visualNotes: Screen recording of terminal showing git reflog output

sections.text: Number two: git stash. About to switch branches but don't want to commit? Git stash saves your changes temporarily. Git stash pop brings them back.
sections.visualNotes: Split screen showing before/after git stash

sections.text: Number three: git cherry-pick. Need just ONE commit from another branch? Cherry-pick it. Just grab the commit hash and run git cherry-pick.
sections.visualNotes: Animation showing commit moving between branches

cta.text: Follow for more dev tips that actually matter!

notes: Add trending audio in background (low volume)
